qas.question: What percentage of the Tuvalu coral has become bleached?
What increase caused by the El Ninos is responsible for the coral bleaching?
What type of project has been started to rebuild the reefs at Tuvalu?
What has been investigated as a means of rebuilding the reefs at Tuvalu?
What is hoped will strengthen the Tuvalu coast against sea level rise?

context: The reefs at Funafuti have suffered damage, with <a0_0>80 per cent<a0_0/> of the coral becoming bleached as a consequence of the increase in ocean temperatures and ocean acidification. The coral bleaching, which includes staghorn corals, is attributed to the increase in <a1_0>water temperature<a1_0/> that occurred during the El Niños that occurred from 1998–2000 and from 2000–2001. A <a2_0>reef restoration<a2_0/> project has investigated reef restoration techniques; and researchers from Japan have investigated rebuilding the coral reefs through the introduction of <a3_0>foraminifera<a3_0/>. The project of the Japan International Cooperation Agency is designed to increase the resilience of the Tuvalu coast against sea level rise through <a4_0>ecosystem rehabilitation<a4_0/> and regeneration and through support for sand production.
